attributes.comment:
I have been waiting for my I-485 adjustment since Apr/2004. According to USCIS
the date is not current so they cannot issue visa. If the date is not current that
means they obviously dont have anything to work on till the date becomes current.
Why then should we keep waiting and paying for the system that does not even
work?
President wants the whole green card process including labor certification to clear
in no more than 6 months. Here I have been waiting since Apr/2002. Thats my
priority date. There are people waiting who have filed even before me. The
immigrant visa process needs a thorough overhaul. When the VISA number is not
avaliable, it creates artificial backlogs that are being used to increase the fees. If
the people were not stuck and getting out of the system in a timely manner this
situation would not have even come.
I am against any quick fix. Please fix the process so that wait times are no longer
than 6 months and if you need more people to achieve that goal than its justified.
No more fee increase!!
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Girish
